result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $1,217.56 restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $121.75, for a total of $1339.32, payable to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment. Joint and Several with 14CF239- David Saal and 14CF214- Laurali Lauritsen.
Must provide a DNA sample and pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

1 - Victim Impact Statement

Defendant Billy J. Daniels in court with attorney Brian H. Wright.  Defendant Billy J. Daniels in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 10:42 a.m. AO-Clerk.  Ct notes an Order for PSI was signed 3/16/15 but no PSI has been filed in this case.  State - Victims rights complied with.  Ct reviews Barron County cases 14CF33, 14CF217 & 14CF185, PSI has been filed on those cases but it is confidential.  De would like to proceed without the PSI.  State also waives PSI. Ex 1 - VIS O/R.  Ex. 2 - Restitution request O/R. 11:19 a.m. off.  Back on 11:25 a.m. 

SENTENCE:

I/S10 years WSP, 6 years I/C, 4 years E/S.  Up to 5 years probation, to run concurrent w/ Barron County cases.  Eligible for SAP, NOT eligible for CIP due to age.  $1,217.56 restitution & $121.75 surcharge joint & several w/ 14CF239, 14CF214.  $250.00 DNA sample & surcharge. Surcharge & restitution payable through DOC.  If not paid after supervision, civil judgment. 

Atty Wright to notify Ct of sentence credit within 30 days. 

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

PCR.  11:46 a.m. adj.
Not to have contact with: David Saal, Jaris Johnson, Laurali Lauritsen
